    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(String[] args)
        Demo application.
        • prints the test data using print(java.util.Collection<LMS.entities.Delivery>)
        • sorts them by delivery id
        • prints them again (sorted)
        • filters deliveries, keeping those that are currently on route
        • prints the filtered deliveries again
        • exports the filtered deliveries to file deliveries_on_route.txt and displays the number of deliveries exported
        Parameters:
        args - (not used)

      • filter

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> filter​(java.util.List<T> list,
                                           Matcher<? super T> m)
        filters a collection of entities with a certain filter. a newly created list of entities containing only those that match. The entities themselves are not duplicated.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the entities
        Parameters:
        list - the original entities to filter
        m - the filter
        Returns:
        the entities that match

      • export

        public static int export​(java.util.Collection<Delivery> deliveries,
                         String filename)
        Saves several deliveries to file. The deliveries are saved in their standard format (standard string representation) one per line. This functions does not throw any IOException, instead handles them internally, printing an error message if exporting fails.
        Parameters:
        deliveries - the deliveries to export
        filename - the name of the target file
        Returns:
        number of deliveries successfully exported.

      • print

        public static void print​(java.util.Collection<Delivery> deliveries)
        Prints deliveries line by line.

        Adds a short header before printing the String representation of all deliveries line by line. For a single delivery the standard string representation provided by Delivery.toString() is used.

        Parameters:
        deliveries - the deliveries to print.
        Hint:
        provided
